intro: Macodes petola var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved mala mujer, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are fragrant and attract various pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
